Article.ArticleTitle: Disinfection efficiency test for contaminated surgical mask by using Ozone generator.

AbstractText: Ozone (O<sub>3</sub>) is an effective disinfectant agent that leaves no harmful residues. Due to the global health crisis caused by the COVID-19 pandemic, surgical masks are in high demand, with some needing to be reused in certain regions. This study aims to evaluate the effects of O<sub>3</sub> for pathogen disinfection on reused surgical masks in various conditions.

O<sub>3</sub> generators, a modified PZ 2-4 for Air (2000 mg O<sub>3</sub>/L) and a modified PZ 7 -2HO for Air (500 mg O<sub>3</sub>/L), were used together with 1.063 m<sup>3</sup> (0.68 × 0.68 × 2.3 m) and 0.456 m<sup>3</sup> (0.68 × 0.68 × 1.15 m) acrylic boxes as well as a room-sized 56 m<sup>3</sup> (4 × 4 × 3.5 m) box to provide 3 conditions for the disinfection of masks contaminated with enveloped RNA virus (10<sup>5</sup> FFU/mL), bacteria (10<sup>3</sup> CFU/mL) and fungi (10<sup>2</sup> spores/mL).

The virucidal effects were 82.99% and 81.70% after 15 min of treatment with 2000 mg/L O<sub>3</sub> at 1.063 m<sup>3</sup> and 500 mg/L O<sub>3</sub> at 0.456 m<sup>3</sup>, respectively. The viral killing effect was increased over time and reached more than 95% after 2 h of incubation in both conditions. By using 2000 mg/L O<sub>3</sub> in a 1.063 m<sup>3</sup> box, the growth of bacteria and fungi was found to be completely inhibited on surgical masks after 30 min and 2 h of treatment, respectively. Using a lower-dose O<sub>3</sub> generator at 500 mg O<sub>3</sub>/L in 0.456 m<sup>3</sup> provided lower efficiency, although the difference was not significant. Using O<sub>3</sub> at 2000 mg O<sub>3</sub>/L or 500 mg O<sub>3</sub>/L in a 56 m<sup>3</sup> room is efficient for the disinfection of all pathogens on the surface of reused surgical masks.

This study provided the conditions for using O<sub>3</sub> (500-2000 mg/L) to reduce pathogens and disinfect contaminated surgical masks, which might be applied to reduce the inappropriate usage of reused surgical masks.
